content.description:
Sit start for Lumpy Space Princess.

 Begin in the cavity down to the right at the base of the boulder. Do a tricky mantle move to get off of the ground (crux) and onto the start of the slab for "Beemo" but immediately hook left into lumpy space princess.
content.location: Faces the approach trail on the Fin boulder

content.description:
The awkward bulge that faces the trail as you approach.

 Stand start on top of another boulder. Gain ok feet with suspect holds to get onto the slab. negotiate the much trickier than it looks slab to gain the very top of the boulder.

 Getting off of the top once you are done requires some care as well...
content.location: Awkward bulge at the head of the fin as it faces the approach trail

climbs.name: The Finn Red Line
climbs.fa: Phillip Heinstein, Kayleen Shenk, Andrew Ellis

content.description:
Really fun lowball traverse. Only 3 feet off of the ground, but long enough that it will build some pump, depending on how clever you are with your feet.

 The sit start at the right side of the horizontal, overhanging traverse and work left until you run out of boulder and top out.

 Either crank on jugs with bad feet the whole way, or get sideways and maintain a variety of heel/leg hooks. Sharp on the achilles if done the second way.
content.protection: Pad for last move if you want.
content.location: This is the long horizontal boulder laying immediately to the side of The Fin. See photos

content.description:
Fun tall boulder problem on the back left side of the fin (as it faces the approach trail.

 Climb through angular slopers and jugs with a crux at mid height and an easier finish.
content.location: Back left corner of fin boulder.

content.description:
Stand start on the very low angle slab. Work up the slab/ dihedral until you are on top of the boulder. 

 Also the down climb for the boulder - trickier to get down than up!
content.location: Right side of the front of the fin as it faces the approach trail.

content.description: Large Fin shaped boulder down the trail away from the parking area. Several moderate climbs on very good rock.
